main event: A round, red-colored object with flashing lights was observed over Washington, D.C. on August 22, 1967.
interesting points: The object was reported to be about the size of a baseball or grapefruit.
The light on the object appeared to flash on and off, and it disappeared suddenly.
Numerous calls were received by the base operations duty officer, and some observers thought the object might be a balloon with lights.
A Washington, D.C. police officer reported seeing a yellowish object, about the size of a basketball, that moved away when he approached it.
The investigation concluded that the object was most likely a surface balloon with a light attached, and the sighting may have been a hoax.
sighted object: A round, red-colored object with flashing lights
witnesses: Numerous witnesses, including a Washington, D.C. police officer
